title: Is it possible to block out the Sun from the Earth? - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends a lot on what you mean. If you mean “block all the sunlight from hitting you”, then yes. Easy. Go into the shade, done. If you mean “block all the sunlight from hitting you, and your surroundings at least for an area large enough that it gets dark”, then that’s the magic that happens during a total solar eclipse. If you’re lucky (or dedicated) enough to be in the shadow that the moon casts on the surface of Earth, then you’ll have a couple of minutes where no direct sunlight reaches you, or any other point, some 30km in each direction. That’ll make it dark enough for you to almost think the sun has gone away. (And been replaced by the most beautiful sight you can ever see: The solar corona, faintly visible around the rim of the moon. But I digress…) If you mean “block all sunlight from striking anywhere on Earth”, then we need to divide the question even further: Do you mean “realistically with the knowledge, technology and material we have at present”, then nope. You’d need something slightly bigger than the entire Earth in order to make that happen. And we might have enough raw material to produce a (very thin) sail with an area of 130000000 square kilometers. But actually making something that big, and much worse, getting it out into space and placing it in the correct spot… Impossible. If you mean “theretically, given infinite energy, infinite material, no friction, massless containers, no air resistance, and all those convenient assumptions that physics exercises always have in order to make things simple, then sure. Just pick up Jupiter, remove 99% of its mass, place it in the L1 Lagrange point, and attach rockets to constantly fire in order to keep it inside the unstable equilibrium point. You’ll have night everywhere on Earth forever. :) Finally, if you want to block ALL sunlight from leaving our solar system in ANY direction, then you’ve already guessed the anser to the “realistically…” part: No way. Theoretically, you’re about to imagine something similar to the concept of a Dyson Sphere. Good luck with that.
